io.micronaut.chatbots.telegram.api

Class ForceReply

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.micronaut.chatbots.telegram.api.ForceReply

  • public class ForceReply
extends java.lang.Object
    Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.
    See Also:
    Force Reply

    • Method Detail

      • getForceReply

        @NonNull
public java.lang.Boolean getForceReply()
        Returns:
        Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'.

      • setForceReply

        public void setForceReply(@NonNull
                          java.lang.Boolean forceReply)
        Parameters:
        forceReply - Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot‘s message and tapped ’Reply'.

      • getSelective

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Boolean getSelective()
        Returns:
        Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

      • setSelective

        public void setSelective(@Nullable
                         java.lang.Boolean selective)
        Parameters:
        selective - Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

      • getInputFieldPlaceholder

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getInputFieldPlaceholder()
        Returns:
        The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

      • setInputFieldPlaceholder

        public void setInputFieldPlaceholder(@Nullable
                                     java.lang.String inputFieldPlaceholder)
        Parameters:
        inputFieldPlaceholder - The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters
